        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1365100#c15">Comment 15<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Sep 20, 2022, 11:24 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1365100#c15">Comment 15<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Sep 20, 2022, 11:24 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
      
        
          Cc:<strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          yfrie...@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          yfrie...@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        Yeah this is a bit of a thorny issue because we don't have a way to fall back to loading a URL in the iframe if the external navigation fails.<span class="line"><!---->Yeah this is a bit of a thorny issue because we don't have a way to fall back to loading a URL in the iframe if the external navigation fails.<!----></span><br><br>We only consider external protocols like intent:// for external navigation when navigating from an iframe, so if an iframe wanted to open youtube it would have to send an intent URL like 'intent://www.youtube.com/#Intent;scheme=https;end', which would fall back to opening in the browser.<span class="line"><!---->We only consider external protocols like intent:// for external navigation when navigating from an iframe, so if an iframe wanted to open youtube it would have to send an intent URL like 'intent://www.youtube.com/#Intent;scheme=https;end', which would fall back to opening in the browser.<!----></span><br><br>What we probably have to do is plumb the sandbox attributes up to the Java layer and pass them through any intents we send so that if we receive the intent after an intent picker we know that it came from a sandboxed iframe and either block it or open a window with the same sandbox attributes applied...<span class="line"><!---->What we probably have to do is plumb the sandbox attributes up to the Java layer and pass them through any intents we send so that if we receive the intent after an intent picker we know that it came from a sandboxed iframe and either block it or open a window with the same sandbox attributes applied...<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        mthiesse@ I don't think its an issue with the self-intent not inheriting the sandbox as it is doing a top level navigation, but rather allow-popups allows one to do a top-level navigation by abusing self intents, therefore escaping the sandbox. Is it possible to block self intents in iframe sandboxes or even entirely? I did test intents with fallback URLs in an iframe sandbox and they were expectedly blocked (unless my tests went wrong)<span class="line"><!---->mthiesse@ I don't think its an issue with the self-intent not inheriting the sandbox as it is doing a top level navigation, but rather allow-popups allows one to do a top-level navigation by abusing self intents, therefore escaping the sandbox. Is it possible to block self intents in iframe sandboxes or even entirely? I did test intents with fallback URLs in an iframe sandbox and they were expectedly blocked (unless my tests went wrong)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        altimin@ had suggested applying the sandbox attributes to any new top level navigations resulting from a self-intent (those navigations shouldn't load in the iframe hosting tab), and thus not escaping the sandbox in Chrome.<span class="line"><!---->altimin@ had suggested applying the sandbox attributes to any new top level navigations resulting from a self-intent (those navigations shouldn't load in the iframe hosting tab), and thus not escaping the sandbox in Chrome.<!----></span><br><br>Mostly a question for navigation folks, but do we need to make a distinction between a popup and a top level navigation in a new tab here on Android? The two look identical to users. Is a navigation from the subframe that doesn't have an opener somehow worse from a security perspective? Does that iframe hosting page see any difference here?<span class="line"><!---->Mostly a question for navigation folks, but do we need to make a distinction between a popup and a top level navigation in a new tab here on Android? The two look identical to users. Is a navigation from the subframe that doesn't have an opener somehow worse from a security perspective? Does that iframe hosting page see any difference here?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Would it be possible when Android do not want to handle the intent: to turn it into a redirect toward the URL? This way, we maintain the original navigation code path and can apply consistently the same policies: sandbox, csp, COOP, COEP, referrer, ... We also keep the navigation inside the frame it belongs.<span class="line"><!---->Would it be possible when Android do not want to handle the intent: to turn it into a redirect toward the URL? This way, we maintain the original navigation code path and can apply consistently the same policies: sandbox, csp, COOP, COEP, referrer, ... We also keep the navigation inside the frame it belongs.<!----></span><br><br>This is probably more "correct" and slightly more future-proof. Otherwise, I worry about this to be used to bypass every future security property we might want to add. Ideally we want to come back to this only once.<span class="line"><!---->This is probably more "correct" and slightly more future-proof. Otherwise, I worry about this to be used to bypass every future security property we might want to add. Ideally we want to come back to this only once.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        > Would it be possible when Android do not want to handle the intent: to turn it into a redirect toward the URL?<span class="line"><!---->&gt; Would it be possible when Android do not want to handle the intent: to turn it into a redirect toward the URL?<!----></span><br>As mentioned above, we don't have a way to fall back to loading a URL in the iframe if the external navigation fails.<span class="line"><!---->As mentioned above, we don't have a way to fall back to loading a URL in the iframe if the external navigation fails.<!----></span><br><br>This is a problem with how iframe navigations are hooked into the external navigation code. Maybe somebody on the navigation side would know how to turn this into a throttle that allows us to change the URL? Right now we're called through RunExternalProtocolDialog which doesn't give us enough control.<span class="line"><!---->This is a problem with how iframe navigations are hooked into the external navigation code. Maybe somebody on the navigation side would know how to turn this into a throttle that allows us to change the URL? Right now we're called through RunExternalProtocolDialog which doesn't give us enough control.<!----></span><br><br>See <span class="line"><!---->See <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/navigation_interception/intercept_navigation_delegate.h;bpv=1;bpt=1;l=73?gsn=HandleExternalProtocolDialog&gs=kythe%3A%2F%2Fchromium.googlesource.com%2Fchromium%2Fsrc%3Flang%3Dc%252B%252B%3Fpath%3Dcomponents%2Fnavigation_interception%2Fintercept_navigation_delegate.h%23Vt9PUtnhoND3cBskThgENPEjh_lCndEwMFLpIiG_EJc<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/navigation_interception/intercept_navigation_delegate.h;bpv=1;bpt=1;l=73?gsn=HandleExternalProtocolDialog&amp;gs=kythe%3A%2F%2Fchromium.googlesource.com%2Fchromium%2Fsrc%3Flang%3Dc%252B%252B%3Fpath%3Dcomponents%2Fnavigation_interception%2Fintercept_navigation_delegate.h%23Vt9PUtnhoND3cBskThgENPEjh_lCndEwMFLpIiG_EJc"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/navigation_interception/intercept_navigation_delegate.h;bpv=1;bpt=1;l=73?gsn=HandleExternalProtocolDialog&amp;gs=kythe%3A%2F%2Fchromium.googlesource.com%2Fchromium%2Fsrc%3Flang%3Dc%252B%252B%3Fpath%3Dcomponents%2Fnavigation_interception%2Fintercept_navigation_delegate.h%23Vt9PUtnhoND3cBskThgENPEjh_lCndEwMFLpIiG_EJc<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 22<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1365100#c22">Comment 22<!----></a>

          
        by

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1365100#c22">Comment 22<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Sep 28, 2022, 12:07 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1365100#c22">Comment 22<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Sep 28, 2022, 12:07 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        > This is a problem with how iframe navigations are hooked into the external navigation code. Maybe somebody on the navigation side would know how to turn this into a throttle that allows us to change the URL? Right now we're called through RunExternalProtocolDialog which doesn't give us enough control.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; This is a problem with how iframe navigations are hooked into the external navigation code. Maybe somebody on the navigation side would know how to turn this into a throttle that allows us to change the URL? Right now we're called through RunExternalProtocolDialog which doesn't give us enough control.<!----></span><br><br>I wouldn't recommend using a NavigationThrottle, because they are not meant to modify the navigation.<span class="line"><!---->I wouldn't recommend using a NavigationThrottle, because they are not meant to modify the navigation.<!----></span><br>Fortunately, it seems RunExternalProtocolDialog is not using a NavigationThrottle. Content/ calls the embedder here:<span class="line"><!---->Fortunately, it seems RunExternalProtocolDialog is not using a NavigationThrottle. Content/ calls the embedder here:<!----></span><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/loader/navigation_url_loader_impl.cc;l=709-717;drc=a432cd59d51281057ba2a2673ca645a9600bb927;bpv=1;bpt=1<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/loader/navigation_url_loader_impl.cc;l=709-717;drc=a432cd59d51281057ba2a2673ca645a9600bb927;bpv=1;bpt=1"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/loader/navigation_url_loader_impl.cc;l=709-717;drc=a432cd59d51281057ba2a2673ca645a9600bb927;bpv=1;bpt=1<!----></a><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>      bool handled = GetContentClient()->browser()->HandleExternalProtocol(<span class="line"><!---->      bool handled = GetContentClient()-&gt;browser()-&gt;HandleExternalProtocol(<!----></span><br>          resource_request_->url, web_contents_getter_, frame_tree_node_id_,<span class="line"><!---->          resource_request_-&gt;url, web_contents_getter_, frame_tree_node_id_,<!----></span><br>          navigation_ui_data_.get(), request_info_->is_primary_main_frame,<span class="line"><!---->          navigation_ui_data_.get(), request_info_-&gt;is_primary_main_frame,<!----></span><br>          FrameTreeNode::GloballyFindByID(frame_tree_node_id_)<span class="line"><!---->          FrameTreeNode::GloballyFindByID(frame_tree_node_id_)<!----></span><br>              ->IsInFencedFrameTree(),<span class="line"><!---->              -&gt;IsInFencedFrameTree(),<!----></span><br>          request_info_->sandbox_flags,<span class="line"><!---->          request_info_-&gt;sandbox_flags,<!----></span><br>          static_cast<ui::PageTransition>(resource_request_->transition_type),<span class="line"><!---->          static_cast&lt;ui::PageTransition&gt;(resource_request_-&gt;transition_type),<!----></span><br>          resource_request_->has_user_gesture, initiating_origin,<span class="line"><!---->          resource_request_-&gt;has_user_gesture, initiating_origin,<!----></span><br>          initiator_document_.AsRenderFrameHostIfValid(), &loader_factory);<span class="line"><!---->          initiator_document_.AsRenderFrameHostIfValid(), &amp;loader_factory);<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>It seems content/ ask the embedder to handle the request and provide a `loader_factory` to load data from. I guess the embedder need provide URLLoader that are redirecting toward the appropriate URL.<span class="line"><!---->It seems content/ ask the embedder to handle the request and provide a `loader_factory` to load data from. I guess the embedder need provide URLLoader that are redirecting toward the appropriate URL.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        > Arthur, would you be willing to hook up the URLLoader?<span class="line"><!---->&gt; Arthur, would you be willing to hook up the URLLoader?<!----></span><br><br>I don't have the bandwidth and I believe I won't be effective modifying code outside of content/. If you can add some regression tests, and provide some code pointers where the URL can be retrieve, I think I would be able to add a fix on top of it.<span class="line"><!---->I don't have the bandwidth and I believe I won't be effective modifying code outside of content/. If you can add some regression tests, and provide some code pointers where the URL can be retrieve, I think I would be able to add a fix on top of it.<!----></span><br><br>I was thinking: The HandleExternalProtocol API have an output parameter `loader_factory`, I would fill it with an URL loader redirecting toward the URL you want. So the content/ embedder would write:<span class="line"><!---->I was thinking: The HandleExternalProtocol API have an output parameter `loader_factory`, I would fill it with an URL loader redirecting toward the URL you want. So the content/ embedder would write:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>*loader_factor = base::MakeRefCounted<SingleRequestURLLoaderFactory>(<span class="line"><!---->*loader_factor = base::MakeRefCounted&lt;SingleRequestURLLoaderFactory&gt;(<!----></span><br>  base::BindOnce(RedirectToCallback, url));<span class="line"><!---->  base::BindOnce(RedirectToCallback, url));<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>and<span class="line"><!---->and<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void RedirectToCallback(<span class="line"><!---->void RedirectToCallback(<!----></span><br>    GURL url,<span class="line"><!---->    GURL url,<!----></span><br>    const network::ResourceRequest& /*resource_request*/,<span class="line"><!---->    const network::ResourceRequest&amp;         Looking back at this report, I was wrong about my assumption that Chrome will not open the intent from an iframe, it turns out it does (not sure what happened in testing, I think I may have forgotten the "end" portion for the intent URL...<span class="line"><!---->Looking back at this report, I was wrong about my assumption that Chrome will not open the intent from an iframe, it turns out it does (not sure what happened in testing, I think I may have forgotten the "end" portion for the intent URL...<!----></span><br><br>I have here a test site which shows the different ways I know of an intent that can cause a top-level navigation (It is a top-level navigation because the it is redirecting a new tab to the URL in an allow-popups only sandbox, it may be useful in testing the fix --<span class="line"><!---->I have here a test site which shows the different ways I know of an intent that can cause a top-level navigation (It is a top-level navigation because the it is redirecting a new tab to the URL in an allow-popups only sandbox, it may be useful in testing the fix --<!----></span><br><br>https://different-heavenly-healer.glitch.me/intent-sandbox-tests.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://different-heavenly-healer.glitch.me/intent-sandbox-tests.html"><!---->https://different-heavenly-healer.glitch.me/intent-sandbox-tests.html<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span><br><br>If you test, only (1) fallback urls respect the sandbox. Both (2) self-intents and (3) self-intent through the picker do not.<span class="line"><!---->If you test, only (1) fallback urls respect the sandbox. Both (2) self-intents and (3) self-intent through the picker do not.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        </div>

          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          flex-direction: column;
          margin: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
        }
        h3 {
          margin-top: 1em;
        }
        mr-description {
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        mr-edit-issue {
          margin-top: 40px;
        }
      </style>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        Convert issue to new template structure<h3 class="medium-heading">Convert issue to new template structure</h3>
        
          
            Pick a template: <label for="templateInput">Pick a template: </label>
            
              --Please choose a project template--<option value="">--Please choose a project template--</option>
              
                
                   Vpython Wheel Request

                   Vpython Wheel Request
                </option>

                </option>

                  CCT bug Template

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;

        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;

          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;

            min-height: 0;

 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }

 }
 }
 });

  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>

    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;

          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>
      
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>
      
          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

            Issue 1365100: Security: Bypass iframe sandbox on Android via intent:// URLs (possibly due to intent:// url popups not inheriting sandbox)
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1365100: Security: Bypass iframe sandbox on Android via intent:// URLs (possibly due to intent:// url popups not inheriting sandbox)
          </h1>
          
            Reported by

        Description #1 by haxat...@gmail.com (Sep 18, 2022)
      <option value="0" selected="">

      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by haxat...@gmail.com (Sep 18, 2022)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>It is possible to bypass certain iframe sandbox attributes on Android with a crafted HTML page containing intent:// URLs possibly due to intent:// url popups not inheriting sandbox.<span class="line"><!---->It is possible to bypass certain iframe sandbox attributes on Android with a crafted HTML page containing intent:// URLs possibly due to intent:// url popups not inheriting sandbox.<!----></span><br><br>There are 2 bugs at play here:<span class="line"><!---->There are 2 bugs at play here:<!----></span><br><br>1: Usually, Chrome will block intent:// urls from opening inside iframes. However, it is possible to bypass this restriction if the sandbox allow-popups is present and the intent:// url is nested within a href in the data: url.<span class="line"><!---->1: Usually, Chrome will block intent:// urls from opening inside iframes. However, it is possible to bypass this restriction if the sandbox allow-popups is present and the intent:// url is nested within a href in the data: url.<!----></span><br><br>2: intent:// urls will trigger popups that do not inherit the sandbox. (In comparison, a regular popup will inherit the sandbox)<span class="line"><!---->2: intent:// urls will trigger popups that do not inherit the sandbox. (In comparison, a regular popup will inherit the sandbox)<!----></span><br><br>The attached PoC will demonstrate an sandbox without allow-downloads attribute bypass, there can be other types of bypasses which I am currently still investigating.<span class="line"><!---->The attached PoC will demonstrate an sandbox without allow-downloads attribute bypass, there can be other types of bypasses which I am currently still investigating.<!----></span><br><br>This bug should be fixed if 1 is fixed. (Meaning that an intent:// url in data: url should not be allowed to be opened.)<span class="line"><!---->This bug should be fixed if 1 is fixed. (Meaning that an intent:// url in data: url should not be allowed to be opened.)<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: [105.0.5195.136 Stable]<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: [105.0.5195.136 Stable]<!----></span><br>Operating System: Android 11<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Android 11<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Download attached files. Ensure that you change the ngrok URLs in poc.html to whatever you use.<span class="line"><!---->1. Download attached files. Ensure that you change the ngrok URLs in poc.html to whatever you use.<!----></span><br>2. Go to iframe.html, this puts poc.html in the sandbox.<span class="line"><!---->2. Go to iframe.html, this puts poc.html in the sandbox.<!----></span><br>3. Two links should be present, the intent-download as well as the control link.<span class="line"><!---->3. Two links should be present, the intent-download as well as the control link.<!----></span><br>4. From iframe.html, click on the control link, this shows the EXPECTED result, where downloads are blocked on popups.<span class="line"><!---->4. From iframe.html, click on the control link, this shows the EXPECTED result, where downloads are blocked on popups.<!----></span><br>5. From iframe.html, click on the intent-download link, this shows the ACTUAL result and the vulnerability itself, where downloads are incorrectly initiated, even without allow-downloads attribute on iframe sandbox indicating that the sandbox is not being inherited properly.<span class="line"><!---->5. From iframe.html, click on the intent-download link, this shows the ACTUAL result and the vulnerability itself, where downloads are incorrectly initiated, even without allow-downloads attribute on iframe sandbox indicating that the sandbox is not being inherited properly.<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Externally reported security bugs may appear in Chrome release notes. If<b class="line"><!---->Externally reported security bugs may appear in Chrome release notes. If<!----></b><br>this bug is included, how would you like to be credited?<b class="line"><!---->this bug is included, how would you like to be credited?<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Axel Chong<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Axel Chong<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        For both urls, be sure to change the URLs for the control setup and the intent-download setup*<span class="line"><!---->For both urls, be sure to change the URLs for the control setup and the intent-download setup*<!----></span><br><br>1. Replace instances of [DOWNLOAD_URL+PORT] with your own url which you will be hosting download.py / download.php below<span class="line"><!---->1. Replace instances of [DOWNLOAD_URL+PORT] with your own url which you will be hosting download.py / download.php below<!----></span><br><br>2. Additionally note the scheme parameter for the intent:// url, if you are using http, change the scheme parameter in the intent:// url to http, if you are using https, change the scheme parameter in the intent:// url to https<span class="line"><!---->2. Additionally note the scheme parameter for the intent:// url, if you are using http, change the scheme parameter in the intent:// url to http, if you are using https, change the scheme parameter in the intent:// url to https<!----></span><br><br>Format for control URL:<span class="line"><!---->Format for control URL:<!----></span><br><br>http://[DOWNLOAD_URL+PORT]<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://[DOWNLOAD_URL+PORT]"><!---->http://[DOWNLOAD_URL+PORT]<!----></a><br><br>Format for intent-download URL:<span class="line"><!---->Format for intent-download URL:<!----></span><br><br>data:text/html,<a href='intent://[DOWNLOAD_URL+PORT]%23Intent;scheme=http;package=com.android.chrome;end'>intent-download</a><span class="line"><!---->data:text/html,&lt;a href='intent://[DOWNLOAD_URL+PORT]%23Intent;scheme=http;package=com.android.chrome;end'&gt;intent-download&lt;/a&gt;<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        </div>

        Actually on closer look, this is a allow-top-level navigation bypass, as intents do not open a new window but rather replace the address bar.<span class="line"><!---->Actually on closer look, this is a allow-top-level navigation bypass, as intents do not open a new window but rather replace the address bar.<!----></span><br><br>So the bug here is more that a combination of "data: uri, and the allow-popups attribute grants one the ability to perform a top-level navigation in a sandboxed iframe, causing a top level navigation which will escape the sandbox".  allow-popups alone shouldn't allow one to perform a top level navigation.<span class="line"><!---->So the bug here is more that a combination of "data: uri, and the allow-popups attribute grants one the ability to perform a top-level navigation in a sandboxed iframe, causing a top level navigation which will escape the sandbox".  allow-popups alone shouldn't allow one to perform a top level navigation.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
    
      
    <mr-comment headinglevel="2"></mr-comment>

        Thanks for opening this! I am not sure to understand why this is a bug. I replied inline below. Could you please take a look?<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for opening this! I am not sure to understand why this is a bug. I replied inline below. Could you please take a look?<!----></span><br><br>> 1: Usually, Chrome will block intent:// urls from opening inside iframes. However, it is possible to bypass this restriction if the sandbox allow-popups is present and the intent:// url is nested within a href in the data: url.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; 1: Usually, Chrome will block intent:// urls from opening inside iframes. However, it is possible to bypass this restriction if the sandbox allow-popups is present and the intent:// url is nested within a href in the data: url.<!----></span><br><br>We used not to do anything for intent: and more generally any external URL. Recently, in M103, I introduced blocking them in sandboxed iframe:<span class="line"><!---->We used not to do anything for intent: and more generally any external URL. Recently, in M103, I introduced blocking them in sandboxed iframe:<!----></span><br>https://chromestatus.com/feature/5680742077038592<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromestatus.com/feature/5680742077038592"><!---->https://chromestatus.com/feature/5680742077038592<!----></a><br>Exceptions are when using one of:<span class="line"><!---->Exceptions are when using one of:<!----></span><br>- allow-popups<span class="line"><!---->- allow-popups<!----></span><br>- allow-top-navigation<span class="line"><!---->- allow-top-navigation<!----></span><br>- allow-top-navigation-with-user-activation<span class="line"><!---->- allow-top-navigation-with-user-activation<!----></span><br>- allow-top-navigation-to-custom-protocols<span class="line"><!---->- allow-top-navigation-to-custom-protocols<!----></span><br>which you did with "allow-popups". So I believe allowing opening the external application is working as specified.<span class="line"><!---->which you did with "allow-popups". So I believe allowing opening the external application is working as specified.<!----></span><br><br>We may want to "improve" over the current specified behavior, but we should propose and discuss a "potential solution". The webappsec is a good group for this: <span class="line"><!---->We may want to "improve" over the current specified behavior, but we should propose and discuss a "potential solution". The webappsec is a good group for this: <!----></span>https://github.com/w3c/webappsec/issues<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://github.com/w3c/webappsec/issues"><!---->https://github.com/w3c/webappsec/issues<!----></a><br>If you have any ideas about what Chrome could improve, within our outside the specification. Feel free to let me know here.<span class="line"><!---->If you have any ideas about what Chrome could improve, within our outside the specification. Feel free to let me know here.<!----></span><br><br>Web compatibility is going to be the main issue here. It is hard to change things without breaking legitimate users.<span class="line"><!---->Web compatibility is going to be the main issue here. It is hard to change things without breaking legitimate users.<!----></span><br><br>2: intent:// urls will trigger popups that do not inherit the sandbox. (In comparison, a regular popup will inherit the sandbox)<span class="line"><!---->2: intent:// urls will trigger popups that do not inherit the sandbox. (In comparison, a regular popup will inherit the sandbox)<!----></span><br><br>Yes, intent:// are external URLs. They are handled outside of Chrome. "sandbox" concept do not exist there. I acknowledge the intent ask Android to open Chrome, which is likely the same application here.<span class="line"><!---->Yes, intent:// are external URLs. They are handled outside of Chrome. "sandbox" concept do not exist there. I acknowledge the intent ask Android to open Chrome, which is likely the same application here.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Hi, thanks for the reply!<span class="line"><!---->Hi, thanks for the reply!<!----></span><br><br>Generally, allow-popups (without escape-sandbox) is used when a user allows ads to open a new page on Chrome without escaping the sandbox. The issue here is that now a malicious ad can open a new popup or top-level navigation that can escape the sandbox on Android if allow-popups are enabled (see the allow-downloads bypass generated from the sandbox in the video above), it makes allow-popups-to-escape-sandbox redundant on Android.<span class="line"><!---->Generally, allow-popups (without escape-sandbox) is used when a user allows ads to open a new page on Chrome without escaping the sandbox. The issue here is that now a malicious ad can open a new popup or top-level navigation that can escape the sandbox on Android if allow-popups are enabled (see the allow-downloads bypass generated from the sandbox in the video above), it makes allow-popups-to-escape-sandbox redundant on Android.<!----></span><br><br>It can be argued that intent is an external application, but when the intent is pointing to chrome and chrome will not treat the intent url as an external navigation, but rather navigate the top on the current tab instead which wouldn't count as an external application.<span class="line"><!---->It can be argued that intent is an external application, but when the intent is pointing to chrome and chrome will not treat the intent url as an external navigation, but rather navigate the top on the current tab instead which wouldn't count as an external application.<!----></span><br><br>Perhaps there should be a subtle difference between allow-popups and allow-top-navigation regarding external urls (ie: allow-popups shouldn't be able to open intent urls pointing to the app itself or googlechrome:// (as this would result in a top navigation when opened in Chrome rather than a popup)<span class="line"><!---->Perhaps there should be a subtle difference between allow-popups and allow-top-navigation regarding external urls (ie: allow-popups shouldn't be able to open intent urls pointing to the app itself or googlechrome:// (as this would result in a top navigation when opened in Chrome rather than a popup)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Yeah this is a bit of a thorny issue because we don't have a way to fall back to loading a URL in the iframe if the external navigation fails.<span class="line"><!---->Yeah this is a bit of a thorny issue because we don't have a way to fall back to loading a URL in the iframe if the external navigation fails.<!----></span><br><br>We only consider external protocols like intent:// for external navigation when navigating from an iframe, so if an iframe wanted to open youtube it would have to send an intent URL like 'intent://www.youtube.com/#Intent;scheme=https;end', which would fall back to opening in the browser.<span class="line"><!---->We only consider external protocols like intent:// for external navigation when navigating from an iframe, so if an iframe wanted to open youtube it would have to send an intent URL like 'intent://www.youtube.com/#Intent;scheme=https;end', which would fall back to opening in the browser.<!----></span><br><br>What we probably have to do is plumb the sandbox attributes up to the Java layer and pass them through any intents we send so that if we receive the intent after an intent picker we know that it came from a sandboxed iframe and either block it or open a window with the same sandbox attributes applied...<span class="line"><!---->What we probably have to do is plumb the sandbox attributes up to the Java layer and pass them through any intents we send so that if we receive the intent after an intent picker we know that it came from a sandboxed iframe and either block it or open a window with the same sandbox attributes applied...<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        mthiesse@ I don't think its an issue with the self-intent not inheriting the sandbox as it is doing a top level navigation, but rather allow-popups allows one to do a top-level navigation by abusing self intents, therefore escaping the sandbox. Is it possible to block self intents in iframe sandboxes or even entirely? I did test intents with fallback URLs in an iframe sandbox and they were expectedly blocked (unless my tests went wrong)<span class="line"><!---->mthiesse@ I don't think its an issue with the self-intent not inheriting the sandbox as it is doing a top level navigation, but rather allow-popups allows one to do a top-level navigation by abusing self intents, therefore escaping the sandbox. Is it possible to block self intents in iframe sandboxes or even entirely? I did test intents with fallback URLs in an iframe sandbox and they were expectedly blocked (unless my tests went wrong)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        altimin@ had suggested applying the sandbox attributes to any new top level navigations resulting from a self-intent (those navigations shouldn't load in the iframe hosting tab), and thus not escaping the sandbox in Chrome.<span class="line"><!---->altimin@ had suggested applying the sandbox attributes to any new top level navigations resulting from a self-intent (those navigations shouldn't load in the iframe hosting tab), and thus not escaping the sandbox in Chrome.<!----></span><br><br>Mostly a question for navigation folks, but do we need to make a distinction between a popup and a top level navigation in a new tab here on Android? Does that iframe hosting page see any difference here?<span class="line"><!---->Mostly a question for navigation folks, but do we need to make a distinction between a popup and a top level navigation in a new tab here on Android?         Would it be possible when Android do not want to handle the intent: to turn it into a redirect toward the URL? This way, we maintain the original navigation code path and can apply consistently the same policies: sandbox, csp, COOP, COEP, referrer, ... We also keep the navigation inside the frame it belongs.<span class="line"><!---->Would it be possible when Android do not want to handle the intent: to turn it into a redirect toward the URL? This way, we maintain the original navigation code path and can apply consistently the same policies: sandbox, csp, COOP, COEP, referrer, ... We also keep the navigation inside the frame it belongs.<!----></span><br><br>This is probably more "correct" and slightly more future-proof. Otherwise, I worry about this to be used to bypass every future security property we might want to add. Ideally we want to come back to this only once.<span class="line"><!---->This is probably more "correct" and slightly more future-proof. Otherwise, I worry about this to be used to bypass every future security property we might want to add. Ideally we want to come back to this only once.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        > This is a problem with how iframe navigations are hooked into the external navigation code. Right now we're called through RunExternalProtocolDialog which doesn't give us enough control.<!----></span><br><br>I wouldn't recommend using a NavigationThrottle, because they are not meant to modify the navigation.<span class="line"><!---->I wouldn't recommend using a NavigationThrottle, because they are not meant to modify the navigation.<!----></span><br>Fortunately, it seems RunExternalProtocolDialog is not using a NavigationThrottle.         > Arthur, would you be willing to hook up the URLLoader?<span class="line"><!---->&gt; Arthur, would you be willing to hook up the URLLoader?<!----></span><br><br>I don't have the bandwidth and I believe I won't be effective modifying code outside of content/. If you can add some regression tests, and provide some code pointers where the URL can be retrieve, I think I would be able to add a fix on top of it.<span class="line"><!---->I don't have the bandwidth and I believe I won't be effective modifying code outside of content/. If you can add some regression tests, and provide some code pointers where the URL can be retrieve, I think I would be able to add a fix on top of it.<!----></span><br><br>I was thinking: The HandleExternalProtocol API have an output parameter `loader_factory`, I would fill it with an URL loader redirecting toward the URL you want. So the content/ embedder would write:<span class="line"><!---->I was thinking: The HandleExternalProtocol API have an output parameter `loader_factory`, I would fill it with an URL loader redirecting toward the URL you want. So the content/ embedder would write:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>*loader_factor = base::MakeRefCounted<SingleRequestURLLoaderFactory>(<span class="line"><!---->*loader_factor = base::MakeRefCounted&lt;SingleRequestURLLoaderFactory&gt;(<!----></span><br>  base::BindOnce(RedirectToCallback, url));<span class="line"><!---->  base::BindOnce(RedirectToCallback, url));<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>and<span class="line"><!---->and<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void RedirectToCallback(<span class="line"><!---->void RedirectToCallback(<!----></span><br>    GURL url,<span class="line"><!---->    GURL url,<!----></span><br>    const network::ResourceRequest& /*resource_request*/,<span class="line"><!---->    const network::ResourceRequest&amp;         Looking back at this report, I was wrong about my assumption that Chrome will not open the intent from an iframe, it turns out it does (not sure what happened in testing, I think I may have forgotten the "end" portion for the intent URL...<span class="line"><!---->Looking back at this report, I was wrong about my assumption that Chrome will not open the intent from an iframe, it turns out it does (not sure what happened in testing, I think I may have forgotten the "end" portion for the intent URL...<!----></span><br><br>I have here a test site which shows the different ways I know of an intent that can cause a top-level navigation (It is a top-level navigation because the it is redirecting a new tab to the URL in an allow-popups only sandbox, it may be useful in testing the fix --<span class="line"><!---->I have here a test site which shows the different ways I know of an intent that can cause a top-level navigation (It is a top-level navigation because the it is redirecting a new tab to the URL in an allow-popups only sandbox, it may be useful in testing the fix --<!----></span><br><br>https://different-heavenly-healer.glitch.me/intent-sandbox-tests.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://different-heavenly-healer.glitch.me/intent-sandbox-tests.html"><!---->https://different-heavenly-healer.glitch.me/intent-sandbox-tests.html<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span><br><br>If you test, only (1) fallback urls respect the sandbox. Both (2) self-intents and (3) self-intent through the picker do not.<span class="line"><!---->If you test, only (1) fallback urls respect the sandbox. Both (2) self-intents and (3) self-intent through the picker do not.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

subframe navigates to an external protocol (like intent:) that<!----></span><br>Chrome can handle, and that intent doesn't resolve to another Activity,<span class="line"><!---->Chrome can handle, and that intent doesn't resolve to another Activity,<!----></span><br>we should just handle that URL by loading it in the subframe to<span class="line"><!---->we should just handle that URL by loading it in the subframe to<!----></span><br>maintain sandbox attributes.<span class="line"><!---->maintain sandbox attributes.<!----></span><br><br>Some tests were abusing the fact that subframes could previously send<span class="line"><!---->Some tests were abusing the fact that subframes could previously send<!----></span><br>intents to Chrome, so I modified the test code to return a fake<span class="line"><!---->intents to Chrome, so I modified the test code to return a fake<!----></span><br>ResolveInfo for the Settings activity (so that the Message code can<span class="line"><!---->ResolveInfo for the Settings activity (so that the Message code can<!----></span><br>still find an app to draw an icon for).<span class="line"><!---->still find an app to draw an         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.         The first two commits landed on 110, and the following three on 111, since some of latest commits involve security relevant work, especially the latest fix (<span class="line"><!---->The first two commits landed on 110, and the following three on 111, since some of latest commits involve security relevant work, especially the latest fix (<!----></span>29b2b78e9a513fd68d5b9f74033be0222135bc7f<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/29b2b78e9a513fd68d5b9f74033be0222135bc7f"><!---->29b2b78e9a513fd68d5b9f74033be0222135bc7f<!----></a>) I'm not going to include/consider this as fixed in the first release of M110 shipping on Tuesday. <span class="line"><!---->) I'm not going to include/consider this as fixed in the first release of M110 shipping on Tuesday. <!----></span><br>This should be included fixed in M111 or we can discuss backmerging some or all of the latest commits to M110 to be included in M110/Stable respin in a little over two weeks.<span class="line"><!---->This should be included fixed in M111 or we can discuss backmerging some or all of the latest commits to M110 to be included in M110/Stable respin in a little over two weeks.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
    
      
    <mr-comment headinglevel="2"></mr-comment>

    <mr-error hidden=""><!----><!----></mr-error>
        
          
       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement.

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {

        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;

          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;

            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }

            width: 100%;

            min-height: 0;

          }

    <mr-app loginurl="https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https%3A%2F%2Fuc.appengine.google.com%2F_ah%2Fconflogin%3Fcontinue%3Dhttps%253A%252F%252Fbugs.chromium.org%252Fp%252Fchromium%252Fissues%252Fdetail%253Fid%253D1365100%2526q%253Dlabel%25253Aexternal_security_report%2526can%253D1%2526start%253D1800" logouturl="https://bugs.chromium.org/_ah/logout?continue=https://accounts.google.com/Logout%3Fcontinue%3Dhttps://uc.appengine.google.com/_ah/logout%253Fcontinue%253Dhttps://www.google.com/url%25253Fsa%25253DD%252526q%25253Dhttps://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail%2525253Fid%2525253D1365100%25252526q%2525253Dlabel%252525253Aexternal_security_report%25252526can%2525253D1%25252526start%2525253D1800%252526ust%25253D1703403127480791%252526usg%25253DAOvVaw1dnmLfTznZOU45VaOPSGPl%26service%3Dah" versionbase="https://61906-5c6a57f-dot-monorail-prod.appspot.com" projectalert=""><!---->
      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;

          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;

          background: var(--chops-orange-50);

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
